import { Accordion } from "react-bootstrap" import classes from './Accordian.module.css' const Accordian = () =>{ const accordionData = [ { title: "What is React #1", content: "React is a popular JavaScript library used for building user interfaces (UI) for web applications. It was developed by Facebook and released as an open-source project. React allows developers to create reusable UI components that efficiently update and render based on changes in application data.", }, { title: "Components in React #2", content: "Components in React are...", }, ]; return(

React Questions

What is React #1 React is a popular JavaScript library used for building user interfaces (UI) for web applications. It was developed by Facebook and released as an open-source project. React allows developers to create reusable UI components that efficiently update and render based on changes in application data. Key features and concepts of React include: Component-Based Architecture: React follows a component-based architecture, where the user interface is divided into reusable and independent components. Each component encapsulates its own logic and state, making it easier to manage and maintain complex UI structures. Components in React #2 In React, components are the building blocks used to create user interfaces. A component in React is a reusable, self-contained piece of code that defines the structure, behavior, and appearance of a part of the UI. Components can be thought of as custom HTML elements with associated JavaScript logic. There are two types of components in React: class components and functional components. However, with the introduction of React Hooks, functional components are now the preferred way of writing components.

Class Components: Class components are created by extending the base React.Component class. They are defined as ES6 classes and have more features compared to functional components. Class components have a render() method that returns the JSX (HTML-like code) representing the component's UI. Here's an example of a simple class component: Hooks in React #3 In React, hooks are functions that allow you to use state and other React features in functional components, instead of having to write class components. Hooks were introduced in React 16.8 and provide a simpler and more intuitive way to manage state and lifecycle in React applications. Here are some commonly used hooks in React:
) } export default Accordian
